{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3618405,"name":"Dalton","username":"daltzsmith","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/daltzsmith/{size}/206287_2.png","created_at":"2025-05-09T19:32:02.332Z","cooked":"

Another year, another feedback survey. This year, we rolled out a ton of new features in response to the awesome feedback you guys gave last year. A non-exhaustive list of those features and changes below

  • Came out with seven (Kraken X44, WCP ThroughBore, CANdi, CANrange, Talon FXS, Minion, PDP 2.0) new products addressing a wide range of use cases.
  • Various performance and portability improvements to the Swerve Generator and Swerve API
  • Introduced Java units to the API to minimize unit related conversion errors in user code
  • Introduced Hoot Replay - A super easy way to get signals replayed from a hoot log
  • Focused on our Tuner and diagnostics support, introducing a high-performance flexible plotter
  • Lots of miscellaneous improvements for our current limiting, API shape, firmware behavior and more.

We love feedback of our devices, and use that to drive future product and software development. We are very interested in hearing how folks used our products, our API, and more and what we can improve upon for 2026. We would appreciate it if teams could fill out the below survey and let us know your thoughts!

Survey: 2025 Phoenix Feedback

Signal log caused me some issue on rio 1.

Specifically when it write too much data to rio 1 built in flash (when I don‚Äôt have a flash drive inserted), it will result not able to push any code to rio1 unless SSH into rio and remove all the new log. To makes things worse, swerve project generated by Phoenix tuner had logging enabled by default.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2025-05-09T19:50:43.114Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":426,"readers_count":425,"score":85.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":501488,"topic_slug":"ctre-2025-phoenix-feedback","display_username":"Nathan Zhou","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":66330,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Fennekinü¶ä is so cute!"},"post_url":"/t/ctre-2025-phoenix-feedback/501488/2","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3621456,"name":"Brad","username":"Bmongar","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/bmongar/{size}/228654_2.png","created_at":"2025-05-12T11:27:51.040Z","cooked":"

Feature requests

Add CANDle support to Phoenix 6.

Add an option to generate Swerve as a Advantage Kit style subsystem.

Bmongar:

Add CANDle support to Phoenix 6

Phoenix 6 25.4.0 (Introducing CANdle Phoenix 6 support) Technical Discussion
Phoenix 6 25.4.0 Hey folks! Hope everyone has had an amazing 2025 season and congratulations to the season winners 1323, 2910, 4272, 5026! We are announcing the release of version 25.4.0 of our Phoenix 6 library. With this release comes a long time ask of CANdle Phoenix 6 support. [image] Currently, this release contains CANdle feature-parity with Phoenix 6, and introductory support for LED control in Phoenix Tuner X (Tuner v2025.4.1.0). We have several CANdle and CANdle related Tuner features‚Ä¶
","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2025-05-12T11:52:53.443Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":280,"readers_count":279,"score":135.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":501488,"topic_slug":"ctre-2025-phoenix-feedback","display_username":"Bryce Roethel","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/t/phoenix-6-25-4-0-introducing-candle-phoenix-6-support/500978","internal":true,"reflection":false,"title":"Phoenix 6 25.4.0 (Introducing CANdle Phoenix 6 support)","clicks":0}],"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":5}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":60072,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/ctre-2025-phoenix-feedback/501488/4","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":4},{"id":"+1","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":5,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3621839,"name":"Kyle Reeve","username":"kreeve","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/kreeve/{size}/187015_2.png","created_at":"2025-05-12T15:18:47.553Z","cooked":"

Overall since Phoenix 6 came out all the CTRE hardware and software has worked very well.

One feature idea I brought up in my survey is having a way to modify current limits without a config change. Either per-request or per-slot. I think a lot of teams are finding a need to run with more or less aggressive current limits in different phases of a match.

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2025-05-12T15:20:07.337Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":245,"readers_count":244,"score":63.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":501488,"topic_slug":"ctre-2025-phoenix-feedback","display_username":"Kyle Reeve","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":10385,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/ctre-2025-phoenix-feedback/501488/5","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3621892,"name":"Brad","username":"Bmongar","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/bmongar/{size}/228654_2.png","created_at":"2025-05-12T15:59:56.307Z","cooked":"

One more while I am at it. have an ability to configure control request to cancel on disable. This is a safety feature to prevent problems in testing where the bot is disabled then looked at then reenabled and having an elevator or arm snap back to position.

We do enable a disable command for our subsystems for this to prevent the problem but it would be safer and nicer to have that configured.

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2025-05-12T15:59:56.307Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":3,"reads":237,"readers_count":236,"score":142.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":501488,"topic_slug":"ctre-2025-phoenix-feedback","display_username":"Brad","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":5}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":38557,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"5126 Codenator / Electrical, CSA, FTAA, Inspector "},"post_url":"/t/ctre-2025-phoenix-feedback/501488/6","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":5}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":5,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3622217,"name":"Tom Line","username":"Tom_Line","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/tom_line/{size}/236809_2.png","created_at":"2025-05-12T19:14:58.157Z","cooked":"

Agreed. We set all our motors to voltage mode and command 0 volts. That way they don‚Äôt move when the robot goes back into auto until they are commanded to go back into motion control.

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2025-05-12T19:14:58.157Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":6,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":212,"readers_count":211,"score":72.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":501488,"topic_slug":"ctre-2025-phoenix-feedback","display_username":"Tom Line","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":38557,"username":"Bmongar","name":"Brad","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/bmongar/{size}/228654_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":7841,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Team 1498"},"post_url":"/t/ctre-2025-phoenix-feedback/501488/7","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3622221,"name":"Tim Winters","username":"ArchdukeTim","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/archduketim/{size}/256125_2.png","created_at":"2025-05-12T19:19:32.810Z","cooked":"

Change the default name of a canivore log to be the user-set bus name, and not the serial number of the canivore device. It was easy enough for us to figure out which log was the canivore log because we only had one, but if we wanted to have a second canivore, it would be tough for someone new to figure out which log file went to which canivore.

edit: just saw the survey link. I‚Äôll put this feedback there too

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2025-05-12T19:19:56.978Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":209,"readers_count":208,"score":56.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":501488,"topic_slug":"ctre-2025-phoenix-feedback","display_username":"Tim Winters","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":19820,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"78 AIR Strike Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/ctre-2025-phoenix-feedback/501488/8","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3623471,"name":"Ryan Shavell","username":"Ryan_S","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/ryan_s/{size}/250016_2.png","created_at":"2025-05-13T19:49:48.324Z","cooked":"

Very little to say other than 2025 Phoenix was fantastic! Slipping in support for the CANdle was a nice post-champs treat too.

The only thing I can think to add is it would be nice to have a bit more information on how TorqueCurrentFOC control and tuning works. Maybe just an added section on how to tune it and how it‚Äôs different from typical voltage/duty cycle based tuning, and perhaps some examples of when it makes more sense to use it over voltage control.

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2025-05-13T19:49:48.324Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":166,"readers_count":165,"score":108.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":501488,"topic_slug":"ctre-2025-phoenix-feedback","display_username":"Ryan Shavell","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":5}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":24486,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"180 Software Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/ctre-2025-phoenix-feedback/501488/9","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":4},{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":5,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3623542,"name":"Dan Katzuv","username":"dan","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/d/eada6e/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-05-13T20:12:03.864Z","cooked":"

It‚Äôd be nice to be able to see the names of the devices in the hoot log, and not just the CAN IDs.

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2025-05-13T20:12:03.864Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":155,"readers_count":154,"score":30.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":501488,"topic_slug":"ctre-2025-phoenix-feedback","display_username":"Dan Katzuv","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":32004,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"5987 Software Mentor üáÆüá±"},"post_url":"/t/ctre-2025-phoenix-feedback/501488/10","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3634553,"name":"Dan Nichols","username":"jnicho15","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jnicho15/{size}/7893_2.png","created_at":"2025-05-23T20:14:54.256Z","cooked":"

I was going to submit feedback about the Swerve API specifically, but I realized I don‚Äôt fully understand how this works, so I‚Äôll ask here:

I noticed SwerveModuleConstants.SteerFeedbackType has a new option TalonFXS_PulseWidth, and this is only FXS-specific option.

Within the FXS configuration, I noticed the choices of ExternalFeedbackSensorSourceValue are similar to the FX FeedbackSensorSourceValue enumeration, with RotorSensor replaced with Commutation and the addition of PulseWidth and Quadrature.

There doesn‚Äôt (yet) appear to be any sensing modes which fuse/sync the commutation sensor against a Gadgeteer-port sensor (i.e. a Mag Encoder). I haven‚Äôt tried it yet on a bot, but I can‚Äôt imagine the velocity measurement fidelity would be that great driving swerve azimuth PID directly with a 1:1 pulse width sensor?

I know the hall sensor measurement on an FXS is rather lower fidelity than the internal magnetic rotor encoder on an FX, but I‚Äôd still imagine it‚Äôs better than trying to calculate velocity from an external pulse width that‚Äôs probably only updating at 250Hz. Certainly a hardwired 250Hz sensor is better than a non-Pro, non-FD CANcoder at 100Hz, but it seems like there is a gap where a ‚ÄúFusedPulseWidth‚Äù mode would give a respectable middle ground?

In a similar vein, another useful feedback option might be the return of something like the TalonSRX_SelectedSensor remote sensor type. I suppose for teams that use the PowerPole adapter boards it isn‚Äôt as big of a deal because they can power CANcoders straight from a Kraken, but for us we could have saved a couple wires going up our elevator if we could have ‚Äòborrowed‚Äô the sensor port on an FXS/SRX to use as a fused sensor for a Kraken. Similarly for limit switches, I see there is a RemoteTalonFX limit source value, does that support FXS?

I‚Äôm not sure how much it was a packaging concern vs. a design choice, but there being no ‚Äòbasic‚Äô external sensor interface on the Kraken series (not even limit switches like the Falcon) is a bit frustrating. I‚Äôm certainly glad the FXS brings back the Gadgeteer port, so we don‚Äôt have to decide between home-running a limit switch to the RIO or adding an entire CANdi for one digital input if we have an FXS nearby.

","post_number":11,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2025-05-23T20:15:57.077Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":109,"readers_count":108,"score":21.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":501488,"topic_slug":"ctre-2025-phoenix-feedback","display_username":"Dan Nichols","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":23941,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"FRC 548 Robostangs Electrical & Pneumatics Lead Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/ctre-2025-phoenix-feedback/501488/11","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null}],"stream":[3618405,3618440,3621456,3621482,3621839,3621892,3622217,3622221,3623471,3623542,3634553]},"timeline_lookup":[[1,86],[3,83],[9,82],[11,72]],"suggested_topics":[{"id":472216,"title":"Have any other teams implemented Nuclino?","fancy_title":"Have any other teams implemented Nuclino?","slug":"have-any-other-teams-implemented-nuclino","posts_count":10,"reply_count":4,"highest_post_number":10,"image_url":null,"created_at":"2024-10-02T02:06:45.234Z","last_posted_at":"2024-10-02T23:52:58.440Z","bumped":true,"bumped_at":"2024-10-02T23:52:58.440Z","archetype":"regular","unseen":false,"pinned":false,"unpinned":null,"excerpt":"As part of some improvements the team wanted to make this year we looked into using a Kanban board project management system again.
